New Records: New Zealand ended their decade-long wait to beat Australia in Australia
New Zealand dismissed Australia for 111 in 17.1 overs, the lowest score by Australia in T20Is
Key Match Events: Finn Allen's explosive 42 off 16 balls put Australia on the back foot
Devon Conway's unbeaten 92 off 58 balls anchored the New Zealand innings
Tim Boult took 3 wickets for 22 runs in 3 overs to help New Zealand restrict Australia
Mitchell Starc and Pat Cummins were dismissed by Tim Boult in consecutive deliveries
Pre-Game Insights: New Zealand picked Finn Allen ahead of Martin Guptill
Australia's top three were dismissed in the powerplay
Post-Match Reflections: Devon Conway said it was a special performance from the boys and credited Finn Allen for giving momentum to the team
Aaron Finch said Australia were on the back foot from the start
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Sydney Cricket Ground
New Zealand won the match by 89 runs
The match was part of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2022-23
